display_asset.caption: Spike Lee at the premiere of his latest film, “Chi-Raq,” at the Ziegfield Theater in New York.

summaries.body: The director Spike Lee and the actress Jada Pinkett Smith said they would not attend the Oscars after 20 white actors, and no black ones, were nominated for awards.

display_asset.caption: Jan Koum, the chief executive and co-founder of WhatsApp, spoke at a conference in Munich on Monday.
display_asset.credit: Tobias Hase/DPA, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: WhatsApp, owned by Facebook, said it would phase out fees to use its messaging service and experiment with charging companies to talk directly to users.

display_asset.caption: Dead common murres on a rocky beach in Whittier, Alaska. Federal scientists are looking for the cause of a vast die-off of one of the Arctic’s most abundant seabirds.

summaries.body: Seabirds called murres are undergoing a die-off in Alaska, probably because of warming water, but the larger meaning of such die-offs is hard to know.

display_asset.caption: Pamphlets were distributed at a community meeting last week in Marion, Ala., that was hosted by the Alabama Department of Public Health to educate residents about the tuberculosis outbreak.
display_asset.credit: Meggan Haller for The New York Times

summaries.body: Rural Marion, Ala., has a higher tuberculosis rate than many developing countries, which many officials trace to generations of limited health care access, poverty and mistrust.

display_asset.caption: Kristalina Georgieva of the European Commission, an author of the report, in Athens last month.

summaries.body: A small tax on high-volume goods and services was among the proposals of an independent U.N. panel to find a way to pay for the world's staggering humanitarian crises.

display_asset.caption: A man was treated for malaria in the village of Kirando, Tanzania. There were an estimated 214 million new malaria cases in 2015.
display_asset.credit: Uriel Sinai for The New York Times

summaries.body: When President Obama listed the eradication of malaria as a goal in his State of the Union, it excited researchers, even if many were skeptical that it could be done quickly.

display_asset.caption: The plot of the book focuses on an enslaved cook and his daughter as they bake George Washington a birthday cake.

summaries.body: Scholastic will halt distribution of the children’s book “A Birthday Cake for George Washington” amid criticism of its depiction of Washington's slaves as smiling workers.

display_asset.caption: Space-X’s Falcon 9 rocket with the Jason-3 satellite on board, four minutes from launch at Vandenberg Air Force Base in California on Sunday.

summaries.body: A satellite launched in a joint mission between U.S. and European agencies will measure the rising sea surface to within a few inches as global temperatures increase.

display_asset.caption: “Creed,” with Michael B. Jordan, left, and Sylvester Stallone, who received an Oscar nomination for his performance in this film about black lives.

summaries.body: For the second year in a row, the Academy failed to recognize any minority actors. Our chief film critics and our critic at large examine what in the world is going on.

display_asset.caption: Chipotle said it was served a subpoena related to a norovirus outbreak at a California restaurant.

summaries.body: After a series of E. coli outbreaks, Chipotle said it would delay the opening of all its stores for a few hours on Feb. 8 in order to give employees food-safety training.

display_asset.caption: Sean Penn at an event he put on to raise money for the Haitian Relief Organization on Saturday. He spoke with CBS on Thursday about his meeting with the Mexican drug lord Joaquín Guzmán Loera.
display_asset.credit: Emily Berl for The New York Times

summaries.body: "My article has failed," Sean Penn told CBS in an interview about his account in Rolling Stone of secretly meeting El Chapo, the fugitive Mexican drug lord, before his capture.

display_asset.caption: The Orleans Indigent Defender Program office in the Criminal Court building in New Orleans in 2006. Funding for Louisiana’s public defender program relies in great part on fees assessed on traffic tickets.
display_asset.credit: Lee Celano for The New York Times

summaries.body: The cash-starved public defender’s office in New Orleans puts poor defendants on a "waiting list" for lawyers, according to a lawsuit filed by the A.C.L.U.
The Coast Guard and the Navy in Hawaii are looking off the north shore of Oahu for a dozen Marines aboard two helicopters believed to have crashed hours earlier.

display_asset.caption: René Angélil discovered Celine Dion when she was 12 years old, guided her to stardom as her manager and then married her.

summaries.body: René Angélil, who discovered the singer Celine Dion when she was 12, guided her to stardom as her manager and then married her, has died of throat cancer. He was 73.

display_asset.caption: A Renault car dealership on Thursday in Strasbourg, France. Renault shares plunged over 20 percent before recovering some.

summaries.body: The French government said that several cars by Renault and other automakers had failed emissions tests, but that there was no sign of cheating in non-Volkswagen models.
The average age of first-time mothers is now 26 in the United States, an all-time high, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

display_asset.caption: Dov Charney, the ousted founder of American Apparel, at the company’s headquarters in Los Angeles in 2011.
display_asset.credit: Ann Johansson for The New York Times

summaries.body: American Apparel is said to have rejected a takeover offer from investors aligned with the retailer’s ousted founder, Dov Charney, ahead of a bankruptcy hearing.
SoulCycle has a deal to sell its workout gear at Target, which also includes spinning classes at some stores.

display_asset.caption: Caitlyn Jenner accepted the Arthur Ashe Courage Award at the ESPYs last year.

summaries.body: Despite modest ratings, Caitlyn Jenner says Season 2 of "I Am Cait," which begins March 6 on E!, will continue to be more issue-minded than other reality shows.

display_asset.caption: Inmates at a prison outside of Novgorod, south of St. Petersburg, in 2008. Under a new rule, detainees in pretrial detention centers will be banned from using the slang of the Russian prison system, known as “fenya.”
display_asset.credit: James Hill for The New York Times

summaries.body: Russia has banned a traditional foul-mouthed prison slang called fenya. But there was no indication of how the rule would be enforced. Above, prisoners in 2008.

display_asset.caption: Representative Jackie Speier, Democrat of California, is pushing for legislation to address sexism at universities.

summaries.body: Women in astronomy are using the hashtag #astroSH to tell stories of harassment, after Representative Jackie Speier's call to address sexism at universities.

display_asset.caption: Cargo ships in the Port of Los Angeles in San Pedro, Calif., last month. Amazon’s China subsidiary has received United States approval to ship ocean freight for other companies.
display_asset.credit: Scott Varley/The Daily Breeze, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Amazon's China subsidiary has received approval to ship ocean freight for other companies, which could make it cheaper for sellers to move goods from China to America.
A Belgian-Moroccan man, Chakib Akrouh, has been confirmed through DNA as one of the Paris attackers, reducing the number of unidentified jihadists to two.

display_asset.caption: Hurricane Alex over the Atlantic on Thursday.

summaries.body: Alex, a Category 1 hurricane speeding toward a string of islands off the coast of Portugal, is the first January-born hurricane in the Atlantic Ocean since 1938.

display_asset.caption: The apartment building in Munich where Cornelius Gurlitt lived, shown in 2013.

summaries.body: Five works of art amassed by a Nazi-era art dealer and recovered from a Munich apartment were wrongfully taken from Jews, a task force found.

display_asset.caption: Students at Ashwaubenon High School in Green Bay, Wis., protested a policy on chants during sporting events.

summaries.body: High school sports officials in Wisconsin are trying to defuse a controversy over an effort to crack down on uncivil fan behavior, such as chants of "air ball" and “scoreboard.”

display_asset.caption: Ms. Olsen, who was from Florida, in an undated photo.

summaries.body: The police in Florence, Italy, arrested a Senegalese man in connection with the death of Ashley Ann Olsen, 35, an American artist from Florida.

display_asset.caption: L train ridership has grown to more than 300,000 people on average each weekday.
display_asset.credit: Bryan Thomas for The New York Times

summaries.body: The subway tunnel that carries the L train between Manhattan and Brooklyn could be shut down for more than a year in order to fix damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.

display_asset.caption: Some 175 portraits made from Lego pieces in the installation “Trace” during a preview in 2014 of the art exhibition "@Large: Ai Weiwei on Alcatraz Island.”

summaries.body: Lego, which denied the artist Ai Weiwei’s request for a bulk order because he planned to create a political work of art, will now allow such projects, with restrictions.
Congressional Republicans have begun their annual retreat, where they hash out their policy goals. The event runs for two days in Baltimore.
